channel.title: Sports: Sports News, Scores, Analysis, Schedules & More - The Washington Post
channel.description: The Washington Post Sports section provides sports news, video, scores, analysis and updates about high school, college, and pro sports teams, including the Capitals, Nationals, Redskins, United and Wizards. Post Sports also offers blogs and discussions about the latest sports news.

image.title: Sports: Sports News, Scores, Analysis, Schedules & More - The Washington Post

item.title: J.J. Watt loses bet, wears Ohio State hoodies, will probably have last laugh against Colts
item.description:
On Saturday, Ohio State “edged” Wisconsin 59-0, emphatically winning a game that had enormous implications for the Buckeyes.

And for one former Badgers player.

J.J. Watt, the Houston Texans defensive end and proud Wisconsin alum, made a bet with Texans teammate John Simon — and paid it off with a look that summed up pretty adequately just how unpalatable the whole thing was.

Read full article >>
item.dc:creator: Cindy Boren
item.ExtractedText: By Cindy Boren December 10 at 9:41 AM Follow @cindyboren Jacksonville Jaguars quarterback Blake Bortles (5) is sacked by Houston Texans defensive end J.J. Watt (99) during the first half of an NFL football game in Jacksonville, Fla., Sunday, Dec. 7, 2014. (AP Photo/Phelan M. Ebenhack) On Saturday, Ohio State “edged” Wisconsin 59-0, emphatically winning a game that had enormous implications for the Buckeyes. And for one former Badgers player. J.J. Watt, the Houston Texans defensive end and proud Wisconsin alum, made a bet with Texans teammate John Simon — and paid it off with a look that summed up pretty adequately just how unpalatable the whole thing was. A deals a deal… @JJWatt found out the hard way. GO BUCKS! pic.twitter.com/10nNzXQa5u — John Simon (@johnesimon54) December 10, 2014 Fortunately for Watt, he can get a little revenge Sunday against the Indianapolis Colts, who have two Ohio State players on offense. Look out, rookie left guard Jack Mewhort and running back Dan Herron. After spending most of her career in traditional print sports journalism, Cindy began blogging and tweeting, first as NFL/Redskins editor, and, since August 2010, at The Early Lead. She also is the social media editor for Sports.
